Package com.accele.gage

Contains the core components of the General Abstracted Game Engine.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Cleanable
    Allows an object to perform any necessary cleanup tasks before being deallocated.
    Indexable
    An engine object with a unique registry identifier.
    Renderable
    Denotes an object that should be rendered every frame.
    ResourceLoader<T>
    Represents a way to retrieve data for a particular Resource.
    Tickable
    Denotes an object that should be updated every tick.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GAGE
    The primary class for interfacing with the engine.
    GameConfiguration
    The primary settings for the engine.
    Registry<T extends Indexable>
    A general-purpose storage class for engine resources.
    Resource<T>
    An engine-specific resource used by various components throughout the engine.
    ResourceLoaders
    A utility class containing predefined instances of ResourceLoader.
    ResourceLocation
    A class describing the location of a particular Resource.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    GAGEException
    Indicates that an exception has occurred in relation to GAGE.

Package com.accele.gage Description

Contains the core components of the General Abstracted Game Engine.

GAGE (or the General Abstracted Game Engine) is an engine developed for use with the LWJGL API. It is designed to be lightweight, easy to use, and fully scalable. Most operations concerning the engine itself are done through the main GAGE class.

Note that for macOS implementations, the JVM must be started with the -XstartOnFirstThread argument in order for GLFW, the windowing API used by LWJGL, to work.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
William Garland
